titleInfo.title: 'Territorial re-adjustments. Extract from Secret Letter from the Government of India, No 85, dated 29 September 1916'

physicalDescription.extent: This file consists of a single letter.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at f 95, and terminates at f 96, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This letter relates to the post-war disposal of captured territories such as Iraq and German East Africa. The Government of India presents its opinions regarding three main areas:the surrender or retention of captured territories relating to Indian interests;obsolete treaty rights and territorial readjustments vis-à-vis the Government of India’s allies;the proposed readjustment of the boundary of the Aden Protectorate and future policy generally in that area.
